pull_commit_message:
Truncate log silently in release build

When log message's size is over than the buffer's capacity, in release
build, we silently truncate the log message. In debug build, we have an
assertion to warn this.

pulltitle: Do not allocate buffer when logging messages
pullsbody: Address the performance issue mentioned here: https://github.com/djg/cubeb-rs/pull/50#pullrequestreview-389875184. When logging message, we should avoid allocating a string, which may consume considerable time. That is not ideal for the real-time threads. r? @kinetiknz @padenot --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/51)
pull_commit_message:
Ignore the fractional part of the log value

The log calculation will be applied for converting the `line!()` value
to the digits of the number we need in the log message. The fractional
part of the log value can be ignored in the calculation. This might give
a better readability of how the digits are calculated.

pulltitle: Only print filename in the log
pullsbody: Instead of printing the full path to the file that is currently running, we should print the filename only. As long as we have the filename and the line, we know where the log comes from. This is a fix for [BMO 1628132](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1628132). r? @kinetiknz --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/50)
pull_commit_message:
Only print filename in the log

Instead of printing the full path to the file that is currently running,
we should print the filename only. As long as we have the filename and
the line, we know where the log comes from.

pulltitle: Add a top-level README.md as a guide for newcomers

This is a best effort from my understanding of the repository so far, please let me know if you would like to see anything added/changed/removed! I'll likely come back to update the readme in future PRs with more info as I learn more about `cubeb`. The behavior of `capi_device_collection_destroy` should be aligned with `cubeb_device_collection_destroy`. @kinetiknz, could you review this change ? --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/37)

pulltitle: Adjust drop order in cubeb_api::Stream and stop stream on Drop in cubeb_core::Stream
pullsbody: 1. cubeb_api::Stream was dropping StreamCallbacks explicitly, then relying on Rust's implicit Drop ordering to drop the interior cubeb_core::Stream. The cubeb_core::Stream could potentially use the StreamCallbacks before/during destruction, so we need to free these after the cubeb_core::Stream. 2. If a cubeb_core::Stream has been started and is then dropped, it's possible for a UAF to occur where the stream is destroyed but the callback is still in flight. A stream must be stopped before destruction, so this takes the simple approach of blindly stopping any stream before calling cubeb_stream_destroy. The major libcubeb backends all allow this, but it's not explicitly permitted by the API. Rather than forcing the caller to track an additional "running" state for the stream, it seemed cleaner to change the libcubeb API to permit this. I'll file a libcubeb bug to update the documentation. This is intended to fix [BMO 1447097](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1447097). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/31)
pull_commit_message: cubeb-api: Drop inner Stream before deallocating StreamCallbacks.

pulltitle: Adjust drop order in cubeb_api::Stream and stop stream on Drop in cubeb_core::Stream
pullsbody: 1. cubeb_api::Stream was dropping StreamCallbacks explicitly, then relying on Rust's implicit Drop ordering to drop the interior cubeb_core::Stream. The cubeb_core::Stream could potentially use the StreamCallbacks before/during destruction, so we need to free these after the cubeb_core::Stream. 2. If a cubeb_core::Stream has been started and is then dropped, it's possible for a UAF to occur where the stream is destroyed but the callback is still in flight. A stream must be stopped before destruction, so this takes the simple approach of blindly stopping any stream before calling cubeb_stream_destroy. The major libcubeb backends all allow this, but it's not explicitly permitted by the API. Rather than forcing the caller to track an additional "running" state for the stream, it seemed cleaner to change the libcubeb API to permit this. I'll file a libcubeb bug to update the documentation. This is intended to fix [BMO 1447097](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1447097). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/31)
pull_commit_message:
cubeb-core: Stop cubeb_stream before destroying it in Drop.

A running cubeb_stream *must* be stopped before calling
cubeb_stream_destroy, otherwise it's possible for the stream callbacks to
run during and after cubeb_stream_destroy, restuling in a UAF.

It's not clear that calling cubeb_stream_stop multiple times is permitted by
the current API (although it's currently safe to do in the tier 1 backends I
checked), but I think it's cleaner to change the API than to carry an
additional piece of state in the caller to track whether the stream was ever
started.

pull_commit_message:
Remove the concept of preferred layout.

Channel layout is derived by the content being played. The concept of
preferred layout is meaningless. Either we have a layout defined, or
we don't. There's no in-between.

So we remove it.

cubeb-core: Fix device_collection memory leaks.

Make DeviceCollection own the memory it's given and clean up on drop.
Manually calling device_collection_destroy on Context is too
dangerous.

pulltitle: Support building in tree for Gecko.
pullsbody: Add a feature `gecko-in-tree` that disables the automatic addition of linking against cubeb.a + system libraries when using these crates. (Gecko links directly against cubeb as object files). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/25)
pull_commit_message:
Add gecko-in-tree feature to support compilating for Gecko.

Gecko provides libcubeb as linked object files, so we don't need to
specify that linking to cubeb.a is required.

Standardized on `foreign_types` crate * Remove split of some FFI definitions in `cubeb-core` and some in `cubeb-backend` * Implemented automatic checking of `cubeb-sys` FFI bindings using `ctest` crate * Move `log` macros to both `cubeb-api` and `cubeb-backend` with shared core in `cubeb-core` * Reformatted source with `rustfmt` - standardized config in `rustfmt.toml` --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/23)
pull_commit_message: Remove rustfmt.toml and format all the code.

pulltitle: Modify Context & Stream traits from &self to &mut self.
pullsbody: This allows implementations to change internal state without resorting interior mutability shenanigans. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/22)
pull_commit_message:
Modify Context & Stream traits from &self to &mut self.

This allows implementations to change internal state without resorting
interior mutability shenanigans.

pulltitle: Bump libcubeb and expose cubeb stream prefs
pullsbody: With https://github.com/kinetiknz/cubeb/pull/387 being merged, cubeb now exposes a stream preferences member on stream params. These prefs can be used to request loopback streams. This PR updates cubeb-rs to bump the underlying libcubeb and expose the new prefs. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/20)
pull_commit_message: Update libcubeb submodule to pick up kinetiknz/cubeb#387

pulltitle: Bump libcubeb and expose cubeb stream prefs
pullsbody: With https://github.com/kinetiknz/cubeb/pull/387 being merged, cubeb now exposes a stream preferences member on stream params. These prefs can be used to request loopback streams. This PR updates cubeb-rs to bump the underlying libcubeb and expose the new prefs. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/20)
pull_commit_message:
Expose new StreamPrefs member on StreamParams.

cubeb has been updated to expose a preferences field on cubeb_stream_params.
This commit updates the rust impl to also expose this, as well as adding
appropriate tests.

pulltitle: Bump libcubeb and expose cubeb stream prefs
pullsbody: With https://github.com/kinetiknz/cubeb/pull/387 being merged, cubeb now exposes a stream preferences member on stream params. These prefs can be used to request loopback streams. This PR updates cubeb-rs to bump the underlying libcubeb and expose the new prefs. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/djg/cubeb-rs/20)
pull_commit_message:
Bump cubeb-api version to 0.3.2.

Exposing StreamPrefs alters the API surface, so bump the version.

pulltitle: cubeb-api: Fix linker path after libcubeb submodule update.
pullsbody:
https://github.com/kinetiknz/cubeb/commit/871456d0 causes the library to be generated in a lib subdirectory rather than in the root of the build output, so update build.rs to search in the new location.

If I had tested properly this change should've been included in PR #17, sorry!
pull_commit_message:
cubeb-api: Fix linker path after libcubeb submodule update.

https://github.com/kinetiknz/cubeb/commit/871456d0 causes the library to
be generated in a lib subdirectory rather than in the root of the build
output, so update build.rs to search in the new location.

pullsbody: Fixes #10
pull_commit_message: cubeb-core: Remove StreamType and cubeb_stream_type.

pullsbody: Fixes #10
pull_commit_message: cubeb-api: Remove StreamType.
Move cubeb-rs files into cubeb-api/
cubeb-core: Move raw types from cubeb-api into ffi module.
cubeb-api: Update raw types to reference cubeb-core::ffi.
cubeb-core: Incorporate FFI type wrappers from cubeb-api.
cubeb-backend: Start crate.
cubeb-backend: Move common functionality to cubeb-core and cubeb-api.
cubeb-backend: Add helper for creating C api binding.
cubeb-core: Fixup and test ErrorCode conversion.
cubeb-backend: mutate all the self!
cubeb-backend: Change get_preferred_channel_layout to return FFI type.
cubeb-core: Add From conversion trait for SampleFormat, ChannelLayout

cubeb-backend: Fix passing of cubeb_stream_params via cubeb_get_min_latency

It's pass-by-value in the backend, but pass-by-pointer in the API.
cubeb-backend: All Stream trait fn take &mut self.
cubeb-core: Allow raw() conversion for DeviceInfo.

cubeb-api: Remove where Frame from StreamCallback Frame type.

The type of StreamCallback::Frame had to implement Frame, which
provided a fn layout() which wasn't being used.
cubeb-api: Implement IntoCString for Vec<u8>
cubeb-core: Implement Clone, Copy, Debug for Device

cubeb-core: Make _bytes() functions public.

It's useful to have access to raw *const c_char strings as &[u8]
instead of as &str.

cubeb-backend: To &mut self or not &mut self.

After talking over issues I have with borrowck, have decided to change
the signature of all traits to &self. The implementator must then use
interior mutability to achieve state mutation.
cubeb-core: Derive Copy, Clone and Debug for all the structs.
libcubeb-sys: Update libcubeb to 09aeb59
cubeb-backend: Implement ops for stream_reset_default_device.
cubeb-api/cubeb-backend: Bump version number to reflect ops table change.
cubeb-core: Fix typo in comment.
cubeb-core: Remove Copy, Clone from structs containing pointers.

cubeb-backend: Rename t! to _try!

Added documentation to _try macro rule explaining the macro's role.
